content.title: Intro
content.content:
1946
Preceded by
1946
1947
Year
1948
Followed by
1948

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1947.

content.title: January
content.content: 10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to A.W. Riddle.

content.title: March
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien, Edith and Priscilla move from 20 Northmoor Road to 3 Manor Road, Oxford.[1]

content.title: July
content.content:
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 108.
19 - Author and scholar Colin Duriez is born.
28 - Rayner Unwin reports on the first version of The Fellowship of the Ring.
31 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 109.

content.title: August
content.content:
? - J.R.R. Tolkien makes the drawing New Lodge, Stonyhurst.
20 - Artist Alan Lee is born.
25 - Artist Michael Kaluta is born.

content.title: September
content.content:
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 110.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 111.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Jennifer Brookes-Smith.
26 - Actor Graham Faulkner is born.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 111a.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rosemary.
? - Tolkien, a fellow of Merton College, visits the college's estates in Cambridge.

content.title: October
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to A.W. Riddle.
14 - Author David Day is born.

content.title: December
content.content:
4 - Essays Presented to Charles Williams, including "On Fairy-Stories", is published.
10 - Douglas C. Kenney, co-author of Bored of the Rings, is born.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Malcolm Knox.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien and S.R.T.O. d'Ardenne's essay "'iþþlen' in Sawles Warde" is published in English Studies.

? - The first translation of one of J.R.R. Tolkien's works, The Hobbit (as Hompen), is published.
? - Ruth S. Noel is born.
? - Peter Kjærulff is born.

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. lxxiv
